html: Consistent with the theme of Greater Babylon’s humiliation that runs like a thread through Part IV of Isaiah’s Seven-Part Structure (Isaiah 13:11, 19; 14:10-20; 15:2-4; 16:7, 14; 17:3-6; 18:7; 19:13-14; 20:3-6; 21:9, 16; 22:3-4, 17-19, 25; 23:9, 16; 47:1-5, 9-11, 13-15), “Kedar’s glory shall fully expire.” As with all who don’t repent, by the end of the final year of the three years of Jehovah’s judgment (cf. Isaiah 20:3) few people who resist Assyria’s aggression—even those in wilderness areas—remain alive: “Your men shall be felled by the sword, your might [overthrown] in war” (Isaiah 3:25).
